connect4

Class Connect4Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • connect4.Connect4Controller

  • public class Connect4Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as the Controller in the Connect 4 Program, allowing the Connect4View to indirectly interact with the Connect4Model.

    The controller holds a model and handles the logic for making valid human and computer turns. Also determines game status.

    Author:
    Caroline O'Neill

      • takeTurn

        public boolean takeTurn(int col,
                        int color)
        Plays a disc in the next availible position in the indicated column. No play made if the column is full. Message with new move is sent to the other instance.

        A new thread is created to recieve the other player's move in the background. This ensures the main event loop/queue is not blocked. In the new thread, Platform.runLater is used so the model updates the view in the main thread. JavaFX can only update the UI in the main thread.

        Parameters:
        col - column index
        color - disc color
        Returns:
        true if the disc is played in the column, false otherwise

      • initiateListening

        public void initiateListening()
        Prepares client to recieve first message, then passes off respobibility to the takeTurn(int, int) method.

      • setModelObserver

        public void setModelObserver(Connect4View view)

          Adds a Connect4View as an observer of the Connect4Model.
        Parameters:
